intro: Salsola gaetula, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure that helps it survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and succulent, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Salsola gaetula is often found in sandy soils and can play a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion.
